item.title: Hiding secrets in public view
item.description: Some time ago, I got intrigued by an article on the Register, finding out about the Baconian cipher. As cited in wikipedia: Bacon’s cipher is a method of message encoding devised by Francis Bacon in 1605. A message is concealed in the presentation of text, rather than its content. So I started writing some code, initially implementing Baconian cipher codecs, which encode text to As and Bs and decode it back to text.
